meanings.definition: The side of a planet or moon that is facing the sun.
meanings.sent1: On the dayside of the moon, the sun's rays are the strongest.
meanings.sent2: During the eclipse, the dayside of the Earth was brightly lit.
meanings.sent3: The dayside of the planet threw a sunny party for all the other sides.
meanings.sent4: She always felt like the dayside of a planet, radiating warmth and light to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The dayside of the moon shone like a golden coin in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The period of time between sunrise and sunset.
meanings.sent1: The dayside is when most people are awake and active.
meanings.sent2: Picnics are best enjoyed on the dayside of the day.
meanings.sent3: The dayside is like a treasure chest full of sunlight and adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the dayside of a sunny afternoon.
meanings.sent5: Children love playing outside on the dayside, soaking up the warmth of the sun.
